title: rc core/command results in a 500 Internal Server Error
body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
While using the `rc core/command` command to run a rclone terminal command remotly results in a 500 Internal Server Error. Using other commands like `rc rc/noop` work as expected.
Documentation: https://rclone.org/rc/#core-command
Related forum post: https://forum.rclone.org/t/error-running-remote-control/20435/5


#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
```
rclone v1.54.0-beta.5050.ef2bfb971
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.15.6
```


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)
OS: Windows 10, 64 bit
WSL: Version 2, Ubuntu


####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)
N/A


#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
`rclone -vv rcd --rc-no-auth` && `rclone -vv rc core/command command=version`


#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
```
$: rclone -vv rcd --rc-no-auth
2021/01/09 16:35:09 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.54.0-beta.5050.ef2bfb971" starting with parameters ["rclone" "-vv" "rcd" "--rc-no-auth"]
2021/01/09 16:35:09 NOTICE: Serving remote control on http://localhost:5572/
2021/01/09 16:35:16 DEBUG : rc: "core/command": with parameters map[_request:0xc00061a900 _response:0xc00022e000 command:version]
2021/01/09 16:35:16 ERROR : rc: "core/command": error: response object is required
expecting *http.ResponseWriter value for key "_response" (was *http.response)
2021/01/09 16:35:16 ERROR : rc: failed to write JSON output: json: unsupported type: func() (io.ReadCloser, error)
```
```
$: rclone -vv rc core/command command=version
2021/01/09 16:36:02 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.54.0-beta.5050.ef2bfb971" starting with parameters ["rclone" "-vv" "rc" "core/command" "command=version"]
2021/01/09 16:36:02 DEBUG : 4 go routines active
2021/01/09 16:36:02 Failed to rc: Failed to read rc response: 500 Internal Server Error:
```
Using the API directly results in the same error, for example: `curl --data "command=version" http://localhost:5572/core/command`
